|utc_offset_DST = -4 <!-- Area/postal codes & others --> |postal_code_type = |postal_code = |area_code = [[Area code 717|717]] |website = |footnotes = }} '''Strasburg Township''' is a township in south central [[Lancaster County, Pennsylvania|Lancaster County]], [[Pennsylvania]], [[United States]]. The population was 4,021 at the 2000 census. ==Geography== According to the [[United States Census Bureau]], the township has a total area of 20.0 square miles (51.9 km²), of which, 20.0 square miles (51.8 km²) of it is land and 0.04 square miles (0.1 km²) of it (0.20%) is water. ==Demographics== [[File:Strasburg 51 E Main.JPG|thumb|left|200px|Story frame residence, late 19th century in the historic district on the [[National Register of Historic Places|NRHP]]]] As of the [[census]]{{GR|2}} of 2000, there were 4,021 people, 1,275 households, and 1,071 families residing in the township. The [[population density]] was 201.1 people per square mile (77.6/km²). There were 1,295 housing units at an average density of 64.8/sq mi (25.0/km²). The racial makeup of the township was 98.96% [[White (U.S. Census)|White]], 0.20% [[African American (U.S. Census)|African American]], 0.02% [[Native American (U.S. Census)|Native American]], 0.10% [[Asian (U.S. Census)|Asian]], 0.05% [[Pacific Islander (U.S. Census)|Pacific Islander]], 0.07% from [[Race (United States Census)|other races]], and 0.60% from two or more races. [[Hispanic (U.S. Census)|Hispanic]] or [[Latino (U.S. Census)|Latino]] of any race were 0.25% of the population. There were 1,275 households out of which 41.8% had children under the age of 18 living with them, 77.4% were [[Marriage|married couples]] living together, 4.4% had a female householder with no husband present, and 16.0% were non-families. 13.8% of all households were made up of individuals and 6.6% had someone living alone who was 65 years of age or older. The average household size was 3.15 and the average family size was 3.50. In the township the population was spread out with 32.8% under the age of 18, 8.7% from 18 to 24, 25.7% from 25 to 44, 23.4% from 45 to 64, and 9.4% who were 65 years of age or older. The median age was 33 years. For every 100 females there were 102.7 males. For every 100 females age 18 and over, there were 97.2 males. The median income for a household in the township was $55,750, and the median income for a family was $58,849. Males had a median income of $35,704 versus $25,030 for females. The [[per capita income]] for the township was $18,556. About 4.7% of families and 4.7% of the population were below the [[poverty line]], including 4.6% of those under age 18 and 5.8% of those age 65 or over. ==References== <references /> {{Lancaster County, Pennsylvania}} {{coord|39|57|00|N|76|10|29|W|type:city_region:US-PA_source:GNIS-enwiki|display=title}} [[Category:Populated places established in 1712]] [[Category:Townships in Lancaster County, Pennsylvania]] [[Category:1712 establishments in the Thirteen Colonies]]
